Home 2025.10

Here are some YouTube channels similar to 3blue1brown and Ben Eater, covering areas like math, electronics, computer science, programming, Java, software, AI, ML, and DL:

For Math and Computer Science (similar to 3blue1brown):

  • Numberphile: While not as visually animated as 3blue1brown, it features various mathematicians and scientists discussing interesting number-related topics.
  • Mathologer: This channel is often compared to 3blue1brown for its in-depth explanations of mathematical concepts.
  • Computerphile: Managed by the University of Nottingham, this channel covers a wide range of computer science topics with a theoretical foundation, including AI, cryptography, and algorithms.
  • Socratica: Offers educational videos on various subjects, including computer science and mathematics.
  • Stand-up Maths: Features Matt Parker, who explores mathematical concepts in an engaging and often humorous way.
  • Tibees: Covers topics in math and physics, often with a historical perspective.
  • Reducible: Described as the “3b1b of computer science,” this channel is good for visually explaining algorithms and data structures.
  • Undefinied Behaviour: Another channel mentioned as being similar to 3blue1brown.

For Electronics and Computer Architecture (similar to Ben Eater):

  • GreatScott!: A “How To” channel that covers various electronics projects with detailed explanations.
  • ElectroBOOM: Features educational and entertaining videos about electronics, often demonstrating concepts through experiments.
  • EEVblog: An extensive channel by David L. Jones, covering a wide range of electronics topics, including design, testing, and reviews.
  • Andreas Spiess: Known for his videos on electronics and IoT projects.
  • Marco Reps: Another channel focusing on electronics projects and technical subjects.
  • Strange Parts: Explores unique electronics projects and reverse engineering.

For Programming, Software, AI, ML, and DL:

  • Sentdex: Covers various technologies, including Python programming, web development, and machine learning, with a focus on practical application.
  • DeepLearning.AI: Founded by Andrew Ng, this channel provides lectures and explanations on deep learning concepts.
  • Two Minute Papers: Offers concise summaries of the latest research papers in AI and computer vision.
  • Kaggle: The official channel for the data science platform, featuring tutorials, competition insights, and interviews.
  • Siraj Raval: Known for his energetic approach to teaching machine learning and AI.
  • Applied AI Course: Focuses on practical knowledge and real-world case studies in machine learning and AI.
  • Krish Naik: Explains machine learning, deep learning, and AI concepts with real-world problem scenarios.
  • StatQuest with Josh Starmer: Provides clear explanations of statistics and machine learning concepts.
  • Jeremy Howard (fast.ai): Offers educational content on deep learning, aiming to make AI accessible.
  • Data School: Provides foundational skills in data science, covering tools like pandas and scikit-learn.
  • Lex Fridman Podcast: Features in-depth conversations with experts in AI, machine learning, and other technical fields.
  • The Coding Train: A visually engaging channel that teaches programming concepts through creative coding projects.
  • freeCodeCamp: Offers comprehensive coding courses and tutorials on various programming languages and technologies, including those relevant to software development and AI.
  • CS Dojo: Provides tutorials on programming, data structures, and algorithms, with insights from a former Google software developer.
  • Programming with Mosh: Offers high-quality programming tutorials on various languages and topics.
  • Java Brains: Focuses on tutorials and concepts related to Java programming.
  • Telusko: Covers Java, Python, and other programming languages with a focus on practical coding skills.
  • edureka!: Provides tutorials and lectures on various technologies, including Java and AI.
  • Derek Banas: Offers tutorials on a wide range of programming topics.

This list provides a starting point for exploring channels similar to 3blue1brown and Ben Eater across the technical areas you’re interested in. Happy learning!
